intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Choosing a character in the cafeteria. Scene 1 of all characters.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Newbridge Middle School welcomes you. Please choose a character.

actors.name: tom
actors.text: So my name’s Tom. This is a good school I guess. You just gotta know how to handle yourself.

actors.name: freddie
actors.text: I’m Freddie. I’m about to get out of Newbridge and go to high school! I can’t wait.

actors.name: carrie
actors.text: Want to know what’s going on at school? Ask me. I know everything that’s worth knowing. You don’t know my name? Wow, you’re the only one. I’m Carrie.

help.text: Roll your cursor over the characters to hear their stories. Click a character to choose him or her.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

games.text: Sometimes you can choose this icon to play another game within the school day.

messages.text: When you have a text message waiting, this is how you read it. This phone only receives texts, though. You can't send any.

videos.text: You'll be directed when to watch videos about bullying. Click this icon when told to see a video on your phone.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Good morning, students. Anyone with information on who is writing on whiteboards without permission should please report it to the administration.

actors.name: whiteboard
actors.text: Inspect the whiteboard.

help.text: What if you witness bullying? Sometimes the best thing you can do is just be there for the victim. Trying to understand what a person is going through will make a huge difference. It will show a kid who is being bullied that you care about him or her and the problems he or she is facing.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

games.text: Sometimes you can choose this icon to play another game within the school day.

messages.text: When you have a text message waiting, this is how you read it. This phone only receives texts, though. You can't send any.

videos.text: You'll be directed when to watch videos about bullying. Click this icon when told to see a video on your phone.

actors.name: whiteboardGraffiti1
actors.text: I hate Newbridge! Everyone makes fun of me! You guys suck, and so does your stupid school! Quite being jerks!

actors.name: whiteboardGraffiti2
actors.text: - Anonymous

actors.name: whiteboardGraffiti3
actors.text: I hate your face. If it wasn’t so ugly, you wouldn’t have problems. Lighten up. It’s just the way people joke around. You’re never gonna make friends if you don’t learn to relax. (BTW, didn’t you take Spelling in grade school???)

actors.name: whiteboardGraffiti4
actors.text: - DANE

choices.text: Make fun of the anonymous kid.

args.name: whiteboardGraffiti5
args.text: Hey Dane. Everyone deserves respect – try listening to people, and don’t be so harsh!

args.name: whiteboardGraffiti5
args.text: Why don’t you lighten up Dane? Everyone doesn’t play by your rules.

args.name: whiteboardGraffiti5
args.text: I’m with Dane. Don’t be so uptight.

args.name: whiteboardGraffiti5
args.text: Hey Kid, "whyy" don’t you "lurn" to "shutt" up?

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Just a reminder – this is Stop Bullying Week at Newbridge. Think about who your friends are. Do they ask you to do things you normally wouldn’t? If they do, are they really your friends?

actors.name: augustine
actors.text: Talk to Ms. Augustine.

help.text: If the environment at your school supports bullying, working to change it is important. Enlisting the help of friends is a good way to change the climate and set an example.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

games.text: Sometimes you can choose this icon to play another game within the school day.

choice_02_01.description: Hello [Player character name]. Did you get the anti-bullying video...

choices.text: I have to go to class.

choice_02_03.text: It’s on “frenemies”. It should be on your phone.

choice_02_04.text: It’s pretty short. Check your phone. There should be a clip there.

help.text: If the environment at your school supports bullying, working to change it is important. Enlisting the help of friends is a good way to change the climate and set an example.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

games.text: Sometimes you can choose this icon to play another game within the school day.

messages.text: When you have a text message waiting, this is how you read it. This phone only receives texts, though. You can't send any.

choices.text: I feel like I should do something.
I stay away from all that, Miss A.
What school did that come from?
Whatever. I think it’s funny. Just kids being kids. No big thing.
My friends and I tease each other all the time. That’s not bullying.

choice_02_05.text: Be an example. Show people how to act with respect.

choices.text: I knew a kid who wouldn’t stop touching this girl when he saw her in the hall.
What happens when the bullying is really mean – like, sexual?

choice_02_06.text: Sometimes you have to act, not just avoid.

choices.text: I knew a kid who wouldn’t stop touching this girl when he saw her in the hall.
What happens when the bullying is really mean – like, sexual?

choice_02_07.text: Not far from here, but it happens everywhere.

choices.text: I knew a kid who wouldn’t stop touching this girl when he saw her in the hall.
What happens when the bullying is really mean – like, sexual?

choice_02_08.text: Kids or adults, people were being hurt.

choices.text: I knew a kid who wouldn’t stop touching this girl when he saw her in the hall.
What happens when the bullying is really mean – like, sexual?

choice_02_09.text: Sometimes teasing goes too far and someone gets hurt. You’d better think twice if you think that’s not bullying.

choices.text: I knew a kid who wouldn’t stop touching this girl when he saw her in the hall.
What happens when the bullying is really mean – like, sexual?

choice_02_10.text: That’s sexual harassment – a.k.a., any type of unwanted physical or verbal attention that comes across in a sexual way.

choices.text: I’ve known kids who had to deal with that.
I get it, but how do I deal with that?
What am I supposed to do?

choice_02_11.text: First of all, you have to remember that it’s never the victim’s fault, even though they might feel like it is. Whenever sexual harassment happens, it needs to be reported to a trusted adult right away.

choices.text: But, it’s so embarrassing. I wouldn’t want to tell anyone about it.
Yeah but, what if you tell an adult and they don’t really do anything about it?
Maybe we shouldn’t make such a big deal about it.

choice_02_12.text: It can be hard to tell someone and get help, but it's really serious and can do damage to someone’s self esteem if it keeps going on. Telling an adult is really the best way to get help and make sure the other person stops harassing. If one adult doesn’t take it seriously enough, find another until someone really listens.

choices.text: Thanks, that was a lot to learn.

help.text: Read up on anti-bullying. Download the documents and take them with you! At your school, think about where and when bullying takes place, and what rules prevent it.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Who’s Zink, you ask? Zink the Zebra is our Stop Bullying Week mascot. She’s hanging around, so make sure to learn more about her. Visit our anti-bullying website on any school computer.

actors.name: computer
actors.text: Use the computer.

actors.name: computer2
actors.text: Use the computer.

actors.name: anti_bullying_button
actors.text: This lesson has information you can use to think about anti-bullying strategies.

help.text: Think about where bullying takes place at your school, and what you can do to prevent it. Check with your teacher to see about starting your own anti-bullying campaign.

gtfs.text: You'll be notified when it's time to learn some facts about bullying.

args.name: chat_zink_button
args.text: Want to find out what Zink is about? Chat live with her here!

choice_04_01.text: Hi there. What question do you want to ask me?

choices.text: Why should I care about bullying?

dp3.description: zink question wording depends on answer...

choices.text: Yeah, I’ll help! I’ll tell a couple friends, too.
I’ll be on the lookout for ways to help.
I watch out for myself. Forget everything else.
No way am I getting into this grade school stuff.

choice_04_02.text: Thank you! Your comments have been logged.

intro_2.title: Introduction 2
intro_2.description: Choosing a character in the cafeteria, for the second time.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Time to choose another character for the next part of your day.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Hi there, Highlanders. Remember, a true friend will never make you act in a way that makes you feel uncomfortable.

actors.name: ross
actors.text: Talk to Ross.

help.text: Too often, people just don't take bullying seriously until something really terrible happens and we hear about it on the news. Don’t let yourself get talked into doing or saying things you don’t agree with.

choice_05_01.description: [Player character name], what’s up? You’re not into...

choices.text: The Zink stuff? It seems okay.
I don’t have a problem with it.
It’s alright. The school’s just trying to make things better.
But the overall message is good: treat people with respect.
I still think it’s ok. You don’t have to agree with it.
Everyone wants to control kids. This whole thing sucks!

choice_dp4_03.text: I don’t really. But I won’t bug you about it.

help.text: Too often, people just don't take bullying seriously until something really terrible happens and we hear about it on the news. Don’t let yourself get talked into doing or saying things you don’t agree with.

text: This is $character_1$. Ur a good kid. Help me fight against bullying!
Hey, it’s $character_1$. Like the way u act!
Did u c Jared’s new phone? It’s fly!
U gonna take ur cuzin to homecoming?

videos.text: You'll be directed when to watch videos about bullying. Click this icon when told to see a video on your phone.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Ever met an unfamiliar face in a group of friends? How would you like to be treated if you were the new kid in town? Spread tolerance by trying out for the diversity play today!

actors.name: janelle
actors.text: Talk to Janelle.

help.text: Have you ever talked about someone behind their back? People sometimes get picked on because of the way they look, or their social status. It can do a lot of damage to gossip about someone, or to spread rumors.

choice_06_01.description: I saw that weird girl wearing a stupid Zink picture on her backpack!
choice_06_01.text: I saw that weird girl wearing a stupid Zink picture on her backpack!

choices.text: Why are you so worried about it?
I’m not tryin’ to judge anyone I don’t know.
Don’t worry about her business. She’s not hurting anyone.
You should mess with her after school!
Let’s mess with her after school!

choice_dp5_03.text: Yeah, maybe I should calm down.

choice_dp5_04.text: Yeah, I guess I don’t either.

choice_dp5_06.text: Yeah! Let’s steal her precious backpack.

actors.name: announcerBox
actors.text: Remember, Highlanders: diversity play try-outs are today. Be sure to show your school spirit by offering your talents!

actors.name: mandy
actors.text: Talk to Mandy.

help.text: One of the most painful aspects of bullying is that victims often feel alone and isolated. When it goes on and on, bullying can put a person in a state of constant fear, especially if they feel no one cares about them.

choice_07_01.description: You don’t have to talk to me. I just want to be alone.
choice_07_01.text: You don’t have to talk to me. I just want to be alone.

choices.text: You’re Mandy. People are talking about that polka dot zebra you wear.
Who are you? What’s up with you?
Are you Mandy? Did you write that stuff on the whiteboard?
Sorry you’re having a hard time. Maybe we could hang out sometime.
You seem ok. Don’t worry about what other people think or say.
You just need to lighten up a little.
I don’t blame anyone for not talking to you.

choice_dp6_05.text: I'm sick of people telling me that!

actors.text: Changing bullying takes more than just talking to one person. What happens when an entire group of friends is involved?

help.text: When one person speaks out against bullying, it encourages others to add their support and take a stand, too. Stand up for your rights and the rights of everyone!

choices.text: What do you think I can do?
Pretty serious stuff. I hope it gets better.
You should meet my friends if you think that’s bad!
Why is the school trying to control us?

choice_07_02.text: Plenty. Help with the diversity play. Or just treat people how you want to be treated.

choice_07_03.text: That’s what we’re working on this week. I hope you can help.

choice_07_04.text: Why don’t you come back after school and we can talk more about your situation. It sounds like it could be a real bullying problem.

choice_07_05.text: Judging her that way isn’t fair.

choice_07_06.text: We’re only trying to show you different paths that are available to you.

help.text: Many students who are sexually harassed do nothing, but ignoring sexual harassment will not make it stop. Practice what you’ve learned to stop bullying whenever and wherever it happens.

choice_08_01.text: Did you just talk to that Mandy girl?

choices.text: I saw her in the cafeteria.
I did. She actually seems alright.
Are you serious? Your attitude is getting old. Let go of that hate, man!
What’s your problem? I’m not gonna disrespect anybody or anything with you.
Not interested. Text me if you wanna hang out later.
You go ahead. Let me know how it goes.
